column4: OK I am getting a message from bash that says "Permission Denied"  Now what?
we were all new at one time and some of us (me) still are kind of
no need to install firewall it is built into the kernel
you are not mistaken also mozilla has email and html editing facility
dont know lets see if it fixes anything
let me know if it does anything
- it shows errors setting up: tetex-base, tetex-bin, tetex-extra, and kile, all of which I had previously installed after having backported them to Breezy.
ok try removing those packages and than running sudo dpkg --configure -a
after removing those packages sudo dpkg --configure -a runs with no errors
- I am a bit of a newbie ... does dpkg --configure -a running without error mean that the upgrade is OK now?
